import numpy as np # linear algebra
import pandas as pd # data processing, CSV file I/O (e.g. pd.read_csv)
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt #import matplotlib
import seaborn as sns #sns for visualization
plt.style.use('dark_background')

#ignore warnings
import warnings
warnings.filterwarnings('ignore')



from collections import Counter

# Input data files are available in the read-only "../input/" directory

import os

    for filename in filenames:
        print(os.path.join(dirname, filename))

source.ffb74adb:
def bar_plot(variable):
    """
    input : variable ex : "Sex"
    output : bar plot & value count
    """
    #get feature
    var = train_df[variable]
    #count number of sex 
    varValue=var.value_counts()
    #visualize
    plt.figure(figsize=(6,3))
    plt.bar(varValue.index,varValue)
    #plt.xticks(varVal)
    plt.ylabel('Frequency')
    plt.title(variable)
    plt.show()
    print("{} : \n {}".format(variable,varValue))
source.d116bf6a:
#histogram plot - age distribution
def plot_his(variable):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6,3))
    plt.hist(train_df[variable],bins=10)
    plt.xlabel(variable)
    plt.ylabel('value')
    plt.show()
    print(train_df[variable].value_counts())
source.d85c86ce:
#after groupby, one method should be defined. In this example, mean
#as_index : false means show index
#as_index : true means doesnt show index
#mean is a method for group_by, Group is based on Pclass
#sort process.
train_df[["Pclass","Survived"]].groupby(["Pclass"], as_index=False).mean().sort_values(by="Survived",ascending=False)


#result : 
#first class survived rate is more than others.
source.923e28fc:
# 2.Variable Description PassengerId : unique ID num for passenger
Survived : alive or dead
Pclass : passenger class
Name : passenger name
Sex : male or female
Age : age
SibSp : number of siblings/Spouses
Parch : number of parent/children
Ticket : ticket num
Fare : price of ticket
Cabin : room num
Embarked : which port for entering by passenger
source.b9092edc:
**dtypes:**
float64(2) : age,fare
int64(5) : passengerId,survived,pclass,sibsp,Parch,
object(5) : name,sex,ticket,cabin,embarked
source.ada61c62: ## Basic Data Analysis * Pclass - Survived relation * Sex - Survived relation * SibSp - Survived * Parch - Survived relation * Embarked - Survivied relation
